meanings.definition: A type of waterproof footwear worn by sailors.
meanings.sent1: Sailors wear seaboots to keep their feet dry at sea.
meanings.sent2: The seaboots protected the sailor's feet from the water splashes.
meanings.sent3: The seaboots danced on the deck as the ship rocked in the waves.
meanings.sent4: Her seaboots were like sturdy shields against the ocean's spray.
meanings.sent5: The bright red seaboots stood out against the blue of the sea.

meanings.definition: To put on or wear seaboots.
meanings.sent1: He will seaboots before going out to sea.
meanings.sent2: She seaboots every morning before starting her work on the ship.
meanings.sent3: The captain seaboots with a flourish, ready for the voyage.
meanings.sent4: Seabooting quickly, he rushed to help with the ropes.
meanings.sent5: Seabooting slowly, she savored the anticipation of the sea breeze.

meanings.definition: The act of purchasing or acquiring seaboots.
meanings.sent1: The seaboots acquisition was a necessary step before the voyage.
meanings.sent2: His seaboots purchase was a wise investment for the upcoming trip.
meanings.sent3: The seaboots procurement process was smoother than expected.
meanings.sent4: She proudly displayed her new seaboots acquisition to her crewmates.
meanings.sent5: The excitement of the seaboots purchase lingered long after the sale.
